historySnippet.action: Updated Params: k_D_growth, k_D_decay, k_DU, k_U, k_A_decay
historySnippet.reasoning: A is already above target and still rising, but D is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0086), so we take a controlled “rebuild diversity” phase by lowering U toward the best-record regime while keeping k_DU low and slightly boosting intrinsic D growth/weakening D^2 decay to arrest the slide without sacrificing high A (noting past large A drop when k_A_decay/k_D_decay shifts were too aggressive around Gen 2614).

A is already >0.75 and still rising, while C is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U near the best-record 0.10 but add a mild challenge bump and slightly reduce complexity decay to stabilize C without harming D (given past large A drops when over-tuning k_A_decay/k_D_decay).

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still increasing; since the best record occurred at U=0.10 and our current U is higher (0.14), I’ll nudge U back toward the best while keeping the current low k_A_decay that historically produced gains (post-2690) to stabilize A near its ceiling without risking the kind of drop seen at Gen 2614.2.

Agency is already safely above the 0.75 objective and still rising, while C is slightly decaying; since best A occurred near U≈0.10 and recent tweaks mostly helped except one large drop at Gen 2614.2, I’ll nudge U back toward the best point and slightly reduce complexity decay to stabilize C without harming D.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0056) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best level (0.10) and lightly reduce k_C_decay to arrest C’s drift without destabilizing A (history shows big A drops can happen with aggressive decay tweaks).

A is already safely >0.75 and rising, but C and especially D are decaying, so I’ll keep U near the best-record value while reducing diversity/complexity decay pressures (notably k_D_decay and k_C_decay) and slightly easing stimulation to stabilize D without sacrificing A (consistent with prior gains from lowering decay terms).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising; since the best record occurred at U=0.10 and our current U=0.09 is slightly lower (and recent U changes sometimes hurt, e.g., Gen 2916.4), I’ll nudge U toward the best while holding params steady to avoid destabilizing a high-A regime.

A is already above target but dA/dt is slightly negative while C is decaying, so I’ll stabilize the decay terms and keep U at the best-record level (0.10) to maintain the high-agency regime rather than risk a phase-shift that could spike selection pressure.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but C has slightly negative momentum, so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 (per best record/history) and modestly reduce k_C_decay to arrest complexity drift without perturbing the high-A regime.

A is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising at U=0.10 (near the best-record setting), but D is starting to collapse, so I’ll keep U steady and slightly reduce diversity decay/pressure to stabilize D without sacrificing the strong A dynamics seen since Gen 3067.2.

name: Low-Gradient Agency Harvester
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by tuning itself into a low-difficulty niche (U=0.10) where agency gain from the environment is strong (k_AU=0.995) while agency decay stays minimal (k_A_decay=0.0008). Its emergence was shaped by repeated micro-adjustments to regulation parameters—especially k_C_decay and k_U—that alternately destabilized and restored performance, until the final configuration preserved high diversity (0.961) and near-threshold complexity (0.902) without triggering any constraint violations.
